node.body:
@kommander Thanks a lot ðŸ‘ 
Merged ðŸŽ‰
ðŸª ðŸ¥› btw. do you have an ETA for 14.2.0?

@kommander I still need to implement a few major features that I promised for `14.2.0` so can't give exact ETA but I expect to finish it some time next week.
Note: you can use `master`: https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js#want-to-ride-the-bleeding-edge
I am using master, but didn't realise the npm branch had a prebuild master, thanks ðŸ‘

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/graphql/graphql-js/pull/1689?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Î” = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `Ã¸ = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/graphql/graphql-js/pull/1689?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [005e96c...00dc7da](https://codecov.io/gh/graphql/graphql-js/pull/1689?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

@mjmahone Looks like it's correctly processed:
https://codecov.io/gh/graphql/graphql-js/pull/1687
It just missing coverage for `master` that should be solved after you merge this PR.

I think this PR is ready to be merge ðŸ‘ 

P.S. Can you please do "Squash and merge" since it will result in cleaner history.

@buoyantair Thanks for PR ðŸ‘ 

> which do not have their own queries in the Schema will not end up in the final Schema

It sounds confising for me. Idea is that schema will include only types that are reachable by traversing root types and only through direct references.
But I'm not sure how to better formulate it.
@Neitsch Can you please help?

I few minor suggestion:
  - Any type not only ObjectTypes so please change `ObjectTypes` => `Types`.
  - would be great to have an example based around interface scenario since it most popular one you can use this code as a basis and remove all unnecessary details but include simplified `Query` definition:
https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js/blob/bdfd1c63e0b45fc48b9c52c2b652680049d76322/src/__tests__/starWarsSchema.js#L299-L302 
  - Can you please move it before note about directive.
@IvanGoncharov Updated, do review.

How about?
> Note: When the schema is constructed by default it includes only types that are reachable through traversing root types by following only explicit references.

> traversing root types by following only explicit references.

@IvanGoncharov Does that mean that it will only include types that are mentioned in query field's type or does it mean it will only include those types in fields too only if they are explicitly referenced in the `types` property of schema config?
@IvanGoncharov You're right. This would keep things more coherent.

@IvanGoncharov Wouldn't the sentence in the schema example only be valid if the user explicitly wants those types (`humanType`, `driodType`) to be included in the final schema?

In which case I would like to rewrite it as such:
> Since this schema references only the `Character` interface it's
> necessary to explicitly list the types that implement it if
> you want them to be included in the final schema.

> In which case I would like to rewrite it as such:

@buoyantair Excellent correction ðŸ‘

By default, (without `types`) type should be reachable to be included.
Basically, entire schema reduced to the list of types using https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js/blob/bdfd1c63e0b45fc48b9c52c2b652680049d76322/src/type/schema.js#L300
And root types + `config.types` is used as starting set for reduce:
https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js/blob/bdfd1c63e0b45fc48b9c52c2b652680049d76322/src/type/schema.js#L141-L158

Not sure how to comunicate that in clear form without causing even more confusion.

@IvanGoncharov How about: 

> Note: When the schema is constructed, by default only the types that are reachable by traversing the root types are included, other types must be explicitly referenced.

Thank you for your pull request and welcome to our community. We require contributors to sign our Contributor License Agreement, and we don't seem to have you on file. In order for us to review and merge your code, please sign up at https://code.facebook.com/cla. **If you are contributing on behalf of someone else (eg your employer)**, the individual CLA may not be sufficient and your employer may need the corporate CLA signed.

If you have received this in error or have any questions, please contact us at [cla@fb.com](mailto:cla@fb.com?subject=CLA%20for%20graphql%2Fgraphql-js%20%231679). Thanks!
Thank you for signing our Contributor License Agreement. We can now accept your code for this (and any) Facebook open source project. Thanks!
@buoyantair Merged ðŸŽ‰ Thanks for PR ðŸ‘
This does not seem ready?

@IvanGoncharov I tried to disable coverage for entire file and it looks like it broke coverall not only for this PR but for all others :(
I'm trying to do understand what's happening.

> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Î” = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `Ã¸ = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/graphql/graphql-js/pull/1673?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [5fc3faf...8049ce2](https://codecov.io/gh/graphql/graphql-js/pull/1673?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

We probably shouldn't expose this, as we're not building a schema `GraphQLArgument` but just a `GraphQLArgumentConfig`.

Having `buildFoo` sometimes return a `GraphQLFoo` and sometimes a `GraphQLFooConfig` is confusing.

Oh I see we're already doing this with `buildField`. That is quite confusing but is fine then. I wish `buildDirective` was also building a GraphQLDirectiveConfig too, but that ship has sailed. Maybe a wishlist for v15?

@mjmahone The entire class is internal it's just a bunch of functions that `buildSchema`/`extendSchema` are using.
So it's just cleanup of internal API.

@mjmahone I think you need to write email that you registered in NPM:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8336157/51245660-0bc62c80-1991-11e9-8090-496cd92a9a15.png)
Hmmm I'm not sure it's required, as we both have publish access, but that would make sense. Also probably better for the person whose auth token is being used to get any emails associated with it.
